head.title: Nordonia Hills City School District News Article

meta.content: Thank you for your continued support a

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.style: position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; left: 0px; background: #FFFFFF;

div.h3: Inspiring Every Student to Value Learning, Community and Excellence

span.p: Thank you for your continued support and flexibility as we work through these unprecedented times. As you know, to help prevent the community spread of COVID-19, the Nordonia Schools will be closed to students now through Tuesday, May 1. Students are currently scheduled to return on May 4.
I have two items for you today.

= Nordonia's National Honor Society is asking you to make a card of well wishes for our local nursing home and assisted living seniors who are isolated at this time. There is a box in the high school lobby where you can drop off cards Monday-Friday, 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Cards will be picked up and distributed weekly. Let our community know they are not alone.
= Working with Nowak Tours, we have made the following decisions related to the 8th grade field trip to Washington, DC.
o This year’s 8th grade class trip has been postponed until October 28-30 , 2020, during the fall of the students' freshman year.

o The Washington DC trip for the current 7th grade, the Class of 2025, will be rescheduled to take place in May of 2021. The most likely dates for the trip are May 24-26, and we are working with Nowak tours to confirm these dates. The reason for rescheduling this trip is to try to help defer the financial burden of families who may be affected by job loss or layoff during the current crisis, and ensure as many students as possible can experience their class trip.
o For more details, please contact Mr. Seward at [email protected] or Mr. Shank at [email protected]

These are unprecedented times, and we will get through them together through flexibility and common sense. Please understand this closure is not only to keep students and staff safe, but also to prevent the spread of COVID-19 as seen in other countries around the world.
As always, thanks for your continued support of the Nordonia Schools, and Go Knights!

span.br:
9370 Olde Eight Rd. Northfield, OH 44067
Phone: 330.467.0580 | Fax: 330.468.0152
